name: IIT Delhi - Indian Institute of Technology
address: Indian Institute of Technology, IIT Delhi Main Rd, IIT Campus

mainEntity.name: Is M.Tech costly at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: The total IIT Delhi MTech fee for students belonging to the General category ranges between INR 3 lakh and INR 10 lakh. It may be slightly costlier than other government colleges. However, IIT Delhi is one of the most prestigious institutes offering an MTech in India. It is well-known for the value of money and return of investment that it provides. The institute also offers fee waivers based on category and income slab. Additionally, IIT Delhi offers several scholarships and fee concessions based on merit and financial need of the students.

mainEntity.name: Can I get IIT Delhi with 500 rank?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can get into IIT Delhi with 500 rank. As per the IIT Delhi Cutoff 2024, the last round closing ranks ranged between 116 and 6102 for the General AI category students. There are a few courses available at 500 rank including BTech in CSE and BTech in Mathematics and Computer Engineering. The table provided below mentions the courses available at rank 500, for the General All India category candidates: Course 2024 B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering 116 Integrated B.Tech. + M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering 204 Integrated B.Tech. + M.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing 417 B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing Engineering 332

mainEntity.name: How much GATE score is required to get admission in IIT Delhi for M.Tech?

acceptedAnswer.text: For admission to an MTech course at IIT Delhi, candidates must have a GATE score greater than or equal to the cut-off marks. The cut-off varies across the MTech specialisations and reservation categories of the candidates. In addition, the cutoff list mentions the minimum marks and ranks that the aspirants should have secured for selection. The overall cutoff for GATE may lie between 350 and 800 marks. This cutoff range is as per an unofficial source and hence, is indicative.

mainEntity.name: How can I get PhD admission in IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: For IIT Delhi PhD admission, candidates need to meet the minimum eligibility criteria set by the institute. Master degree in Engineering/ Technology/ Science/ Humanities or equivalent in relevant stream with a CGPA of 6.00 on a 10-point scale or 60% aggregate is the basic eligibility criteria for PhD admission. Eligible candidates can apply by filling out the application form by visiting the official website. The selection is based on merit in CSIR-NET/GATE followed by an interview round.

mainEntity.name: How can I get admission at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi admission is entrance-based for all the programmes (Except for PG Diploma). For the diploma course, selection is done merit-basis. Candidates who have passed Class 12 can apply for the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi undergraduate courses. More details around the admission process of some of the courses are provided below: Candidates, who have passed Class 12 from a recognised board with an aggregate of 75% or above, can appear for JEE Main, followed by JEE Advanced and JoSAA Counselling to seek BTech admission at IIT Delhi. Admission to MTech course is based on merit in GATE exam followed by GOAP counselling. For MSc, aspirants need to apply with a valid score of IIT JAM and selected candidates have to further go through CCMN counselling.

mainEntity.name: How have IIT Delhi faculty members contributed to the development of India?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi faculty members contribute to India in many ways, including research, education, and leadership roles. IIT Delhi faculty have actively participated in the formation of government committees and helped formulate policies on science, technology, education, and infrastructure. Their deep understanding of technological advancements and their practical application ensures that policies are not only well-informed but also forward-thinking, keeping in mind India's long-term development goals. Many IIT Delhi faculty members have served as advisors to state and central governments, contributing to critical sectors such as defense, healthcare, manufacturing, and education. Their input has resulted in major advancements in public-private partnerships and the creation of frameworks that encourage innovation, entrepreneurship, and technology transfer. The Institute's Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Centre (IEDC) and Technology Business Incubator (TBI) have supported the commercialization of many research ideas, resulting in the establishment of successful ventures in sectors, such as Healthcare, Agritech, Edtech, and Environmental Sustainability. Professors often collaborate with their students to co-found companies that provide innovative solutions to address challenges in these sectors.

mainEntity.name: What are the awards received by the faculty members of IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: The faculty members of IIT Delhi have received many awards, including excellence awards, research awards, and fellowships, among others. The details for the same are given below: <!- [if !supportLists]->· Prof. Abhilash Jindal won the Best Community Paper Award for releasing the paper: "Experience: Developing a Usable Battery Drain Testing and Diagnostic Tool for the Mobile Industry". <!- [if !supportLists]->· Prof. K.L, a professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, has received many awards, including the J.M. Mahajan award, the Prof. P C P Bhat Research Award, and the Lakshmana Gowda Lifetime Achievement Award.

mainEntity.name: How many faculty members are there in the CSE department of IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: The exact count of faculty members available in the CSE department of IIT Delhi is not available on the official website; however, going by the faculty profile, the estimated count is over 40, including both male and female members. The IIT Delhi CSE department has a total number of 6 female faculty members, and most of them hold a PhD. The female faculty profile of the CSE department is tabulated below: Faculty Name & Title Academic Qualification Research Area Keerti Choudhary Assistant Professor and TBO Group Faculty Fellow Ph.D., M.Tech (IIT Kanpur) Experimental Turbulence, Tomography, Power Generation Systems and I.C. Engines Maya Ramanath Associate Professor Ph.D. (IISc., Bangalore) Database and Information Retrieval Techniques for Semantic Web Data Management, Information Extraction and Opinion Mining Priyanka Golia Assistant Professor Ph.D. (.National University of Singapore and IITK) Formal Methods and Artificial Intelligence Rijurekha Sen Assistant Professor Ph.D. (IIT Bombay) Mobile and Embedded Systems (Hardware Architecture, OS, Sensing, Efficient Processing, Security), Computational Sustainability Vaishnavi Sundararajan Assistant Professor Ph.D. (Chennai Mathematical Institute) Formal methods, Verification and Security Saroj Kaushik Honorary Professor Department of Computer Science and Engineering School of Engineering (SoE) -

mainEntity.name: What is the salary of an assistant professor at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: Regular faculty members of IIT Delhi are entitled to various benefits and incentives, which include on-campus housing, medical assistance, and retirement benefits, among others. An assistant professor commencing at pay level 12 receives a minimum salary of INR 101,500 per month for 12 months each year. An annual increment of 3% is also applicable. All employees of IIT Delhi are entitled to a dearness allowance to offset price increases. This allowance is revised every six months and currently stands at 21% of the basic pay (as of 2021). After completing the 3 years of service as an assistant professor at pay level 12, the member is considered for movement to pay level 13 A1. The annual minimum pay at this level is INR 131,400.

mainEntity.name: When will JEE Main 2024 counselling take place for admission to BTech at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: JEE Main counselling schedule is released by the Joint Seat Allocation Authority after the declaration of the JEE Main result. The counselling shall be conducted in the months of June and July, tentatively. There seat allotment process is carried out through JoSAA counselling. Students securing the required marks in JEE Advanced become eligible for participation in counselling for admission to NITs, IIITs and other GFTIs including IIT Delhi.

mainEntity.name: Does IIT Delhi provide hostel accommodation to its students?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, IIT Delhi offers adequate hostel facilities for all students. The hostel at IIT Delhi was built in the 1960s. And, they're managed well to date. The room for the first year's B.Tech is a 3-seater (which was two-seater earlier). In some hostels, there are two-seater rooms too (as there are 13 hostels with different maps and infrastructure). The rooms are less spacious if you and your roommates wish to stay in the room all the time (it doesn't happen though). Below mentioned is a review of the IIT Delhi hostel facilities, as per a recent graduate: "There are 3 beds on which many people sleep (mostly 5+ at exam times). There are 3 tables, 3 chairs and 2 almirahs with four slots each. There are two LAN ports for 3 people. You manage it as there is a Wi-Fi facility too. Also, in a room, there are two fans, two tube lights and four electricity boards."

mainEntity.name: Is hostel compulsory at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: It is voluntary to opt for the hostel facility at IIT Delhi. In fact, if a candidate lives within a 15 km radius of the campus, they won't be allotted a hostel room at all. However, the institute houses 11 boys' hostels and two girls' hostels which is enough to accommodate the willing candidates. IIT Delhi has a technologically advanced campus spread across 325 acres of land. The premier institute has one of the best campuses in India state-of-the-art infrastructure, modern amenities and research laboratories. Currently, the Deemed University has six distinct schools, including Bharti School of Telecommunication Technology & Management, Amar Nath & Shashi Khosla School of Information Technology, Kusuma School of Biological Sciences, School of Artificial Intelligence, School of Public Policy and School of Interdisciplinary Research.

mainEntity.name: How is the infrastructure of IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: The IIT Delhi campus is spread across 325 acres. It is divided into four areas for administrative and logistical purposes. Thus, the campus has a West Campus (hostel area), East campus (residential area), Main Administrative Building and Academic area. IIT Delhi infrastructure advancements and operations are taken care by a dedicated Infrastructure team that works under the administrative unit. In addition, it also keeps coming up with new projects for the advacement of the IIT Delhi infrastructure.

mainEntity.name: Between IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi, which has better hostel facilities and amenities for BTech students?

acceptedAnswer.text: Based on ratings and reviews from current and former students, IIT Delhi is considered to have better hostel facilities and amenities compared to IIT Bombay. The hostels at IIT Delhi are known for their cleanliness, spacious rooms, and well-maintained common areas. The campus also has various sports facilities, gymnasiums, and recreation rooms, which are highly appreciated by the students. In comparison, while the hostels at IIT Bombay are also considered to be of good quality, they are often criticized for being too congested and having inadequate facilities. However, the campus does have a good range of amenities including a sports complex, swimming pool, and student activity center.

mainEntity.name: How are the placements for M.Tech at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: As per the latest media report, a total of 1,050 offers were made (including PPOs) during Phase I IIT Delhi placements 2024. Further, a total of 1,000 students were uniquely selected during IIT Delhi placement 2024 (phase 1). Talking about the MTech placements at IIT Delhi, a fluctuating trend was witnessed in the median package offered during PG 2-year placements, which is presented below: Particulars Statistics (2023) Statistics (2022) Statistics (2021) Median Salary INR 14 lakh INR 12.5 lakh INR 15 lakh Source: NIRF Report 2024

mainEntity.name: Is IIT Delhi good for an MBA?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Department of Management Studies (DMS), IIT Delhi, also known as DMS IIT Delhi offers a two-year MBA course at undergraduate courses in a full-time mode. IIT Delhi is a decent option to pursue an MBA degree. IIT Delhi ranked 4 by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) in the Management category IN 2024. Talking about DMS IIT Delhi MBA placements 2023, the average package offered was INR 25.82 LPA and the highest package stood at INR 41.13 LPA. A placement percentage of 100% was achieved. Thus, it is a good institute for an MBA.

mainEntity.name: Is it expensive to study a PhD course in IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: The total course fee is a cumulative of multiple components such as tuition fee, medical fees, transport fees, etc. IIT Delhi PhD tuition fee for full-time course is INR 7,500 per semester. In addition, PhD (part-time/sponsored) programmes is INR 17,500. The hostel fee for PhD candidates is INR 13,250. Some other fee such as students distress fund scheme (each semester) of INR 400 and insurance scheme (yearly) fee of INR 500 may also be added in the fee. Further, the fee mentioned here is taken from IIT Delhi 2023 prospectus.

mainEntity.name: Is IIT Delhi hostel air-conditioned?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, some of the hostels of IIT Delhi are air-conditioned. However, non-air-conditioned hostels are also available. The hostels are allotted to the students based on availability. Some lecture theatres are also air-conditioned. Apart from this, some common areas on the campus or hostel also have air conditioning or air coolers.

mainEntity.name: What is the sector-wise employment percentage record during IIT Delhi placements?

acceptedAnswer.text: Core (Technical) sector emerged as the top recruiting sector that placed 20.7% of the total students. The sector-wise placement distribution recorded during IIT Delhi placements 2024 is presented below: The sector-wise placement distribution recorded during IIT Delhi placements 2024 is presented below: Sectors Placement Distribution (2024) Core (Technical) 38.6% IT 20.7% Analytics 10.9% Consulting 10% Management 8.3% Finance 4.2% Others 7.3%

mainEntity.name: Is PhD available in IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi offers PhD in full-time and part-time modes. The doctoral-level course is made available by almost all the departments of the institute. Candidates who meet the required eligibility criteria and have the relevant work experience become eligible for admission. Currently, IIT Delhi Biochemical Engineering and Biotechnology department is offering joint PhD programme with the University of Queensland.

mainEntity.name: What is the hostel fee for IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi hostel fee depends upon various factors such as the type of room selected, opted facilities and the course. The hostel fee vary from one course to another. In the following table, course-wise IITD hostel fee is mentioned: MTech/MS(R)/MDes/PhD/MSc/MBA Old Hostels Fees New Hostels Fees Hostel Seat Rent INR 8,600 INR 23,600 One time charges INR 7,000 INR 7,000 Total (per semester) INR 44,600 INR 59,600 Mess Charges* INR 36,000 INR 36,000 Refundable Deposit INR 15,000 INR 15,000 *These charges are subject to revision from time to time.

mainEntity.name: How is the faculty at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi faculty are PhD, degree, and diploma holders. IIT Delhi faculty are well-qualified and are industry experts. Some of the Department of Applied Mechanics faculty members' details are mentioned below: Faculty Name Faculty Details Santosh Kapuria Head, Applied Mechanics Puneet Mahajan PhD (Montana State) TRIPP Chair Professor S.V. Veeravalli PhD (Cornell) Professor

mainEntity.name: Does class 12 marks matter in the eligibility criteria of IIT JAM?

acceptedAnswer.text: The eligibility requirements for IIT JAM (Joint Admission Test for M.Sc.) did not involve a minimum percentage or marks in Class 12 for the majority of participating institutes. The eligibility criteria for IIT JAM are largely concerned with the bachelor's degree and the minimum marks or CGPA necessary to secure in that degree. Candidates for the IIT JAM must have a Bachelor's degree from a recognized university with a minimum of 55 per cent aggregate or 5.5 CGPA/CPI. Apart from it, candidates also need to submit a physical fitness certificate at the time of admissions. Candidates found unfit to pursue his/her science course can be denied admission by the admitting institute. For the most up-to-date information, consult the official IIT JAM website or the information brochure.

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi are the popular engineering institutes in India. Owning to their reputation, both institutes offer excellent hostel facilities and amenities for their students. However, there are some differences between the two institutes’ hostel facilities and amenities that may be important to consider when making a decision. mainEntity.name: How are IIT Delhi M.Tech Placements?

acceptedAnswer.text: A total of 1,200 offers were made and 1,150 students were placed during the Phase 1 of IIT Delhi placements 2025. Further, more than 50 international offers were made during IIT Delhi Phase 1 placements 2024-25. As per NIRF report 2024, the median package offered during MTech placements 2023 stood at INR 14 LPA. Further, 308 students were placed and 112 students were selected for higher studies out of total 827 students during MTech placements 2023. Earlier, the median package offered during MTech placements 2022 and 2021 stood at INR 12.5 LPA and INR 15 LPA, respectively. As per NIRF report 2024, the key highlights of IIT Delhi M.Tech placements over the past three years are presented below: Particulars MTech Placement Statistics (2021) MTech Placement Statistics (2022) MTech Placement Statistics (2023) Median package INR 15 LPA INR 12.5 LPA INR 14 LPA Total students 867 813 827 Students placed 379 322 308 Selected for higher studies 240 159 112

mainEntity.name: Who is eligible to apply for a BTech course at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: Admission to BTech courses in IIT Delhi is subject to fulfiment of the eligibility requirements for JEE Main and JEE Advanced. The students who have passed Class 12 in Science stream with at least 75% aggregate (65% aggregate for SC/ST/PwD) are eligible to apply. Candidate should have passed the qualifying exam from a recognised board. In addition, it is also crucial that the applicant hold the relevant documents as a proof of eligibility.

mainEntity.name: Is it worth doing MSc from IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, IIT Delhi is a good institute for MSc aspirants. The institute has got a good overall rank from NIRF in the 2023 rankings. It has been ranked at the third spot among top colleges in the country. Moreover, IIT Delhi also provide placements support. As per its 2023 placement report, the median package offered to PG (2-year) candidates was INR 12.50 LPA. Some of the top companies that participate in its placements drive are Microsoft, Cisco, Accenture, etc.

mainEntity.name: What is the seat intake for the IIT Delhi MSc course?

acceptedAnswer.text: The total seat intake for the IIT Delhi MSc course is 254. Given below is the specialisation-wise seat intake for IIT Delhi MSc course: IIT Delhi MSc Seat Intake Specialisations Seat Intake Cognitive Science 25 Economics 25 Chemistry 68 Mathematics 68 Physics 68

mainEntity.name: What is the fees for MSc at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi MSc fee structure comprises various components, such as tuition fee, security deposit, Insurance and Student Distress Fund, etc. While the tuition fee is payable in semester-wise instalments, other fee components, such as the refundable security deposit are payable once at admission. The total tuition fees for various MSc specialisations at IIT Delhi range between INR 30,000 and INR 3 lakh. The additional one-time fee payable at admission is INR 16,150. NOTE: The mentioned fee information is sourced from the official website of the institute/sanctioning body. It is still subject to change and hence, is indicative.

mainEntity.name: How much is the fee for the IIT Delhi MDes course?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi M.Des fee is INR 3 Lacs for two years. The fee mentioned here is taken from an unofficial source and is the total tuition fee. Hence, is indicative. For detailed fee structure, candidates are advised to contact the admission department of the institute.

mainEntity.name: Can a boy and girl share a room in IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, IIT Delhi has separate hostels for Boys and Girls. There are no co-ed hostels. The institute has no tolerance policy for the same. Boys can only visit the girls' hostel visitor’s room and vice-versa. On house days, the institute may allow students to visit other hostels.

mainEntity.name: Does IIT Delhi offer free of cost studies?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, the tuition fee for the IIT Delhi BTech is around INR 8 Lacs. At the UG level, IIT Delhi offers four to five-year BTech courses to students. The IIT Delhi accepts the JEE Main and JEE Advanced entrance exam scores for admission to various courses. IITD has ranked 2 under 'Engineering' and 4 under 'Overall' and 'Management' categories by the NIRF 2022. Apart from the PG and UG courses, IITD also provides a PG Diploma course for the DMRC and Indian Navy-sponsored candidates. IIT Delhi has also started offering various Certificate programmes for a duration of six to one year, including courses like Digital Marketing, Data Science, and Human Resource Management, among others. At the doctoral level, the institute provides an MS (by Research) course for a duration of three years.

mainEntity.name: Who is eligible for IIT Delhi MSc course?

acceptedAnswer.text: Candidates applying to a MSc course in IIT Delhi must fulfil the required eligibility criteria. Thus, aspirant must hold a valid bachelor's degree in a relevant stream for at least two years (four semesters) and a minimum aggregate between 55% and 80% or 5.5 CGPA out of 10. For MSc cognitive science/economic courses, the accepted degrees are BA/BSc/BCom/BTech/BE/BStat/BMath or equivalent. The total course fee for MSc course is ranges between INR 30K and INR 3 lakh.

mainEntity.name: Does IIT Delhi offer equal opportunity to students to apply for scholarships?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, IIT Delhi offer equal opportunity to students to apply for scholarships. Some of the scholarships provided by the university are Institute Merit-cum-Means Scholarships, Institute Merit Prizes and Certificates, Institute Free Studentship (UG), Donor Scholarship, and others.

mainEntity.name: Which all Certificate courses are available at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: Presently, IIT Delhi is offering seven Certificate courses, including Digital Marketing, Data Science, Human Resource Management, Business Management, Design Thinking & Innovation, Industrial Design, Innovation and Entrepreneurship and Project Management. The college offers courses at the UG and PG levels across the Design, Management, Engineering, and several other streams. At the UG level, IIT Delhi offers B.Tech, B. Des and other courses to students. At the PG level, the college offers M.A. M.Tech, M.A. M.Sc. And other courses to students. The candidates must fill out the application form to get admission to the Certificate and other courses offered by the college. For getting admission to certificates and other courses, the candidates must follow a certain admission procedure. The candidates must fill out the application form in online and offline modes and then must submit the form with the application fees.

mainEntity.name: Does IIT Delhi offer MSc?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, IIT Delhi offers a two-year full-time MSc course at the postgraduate level. The programme is offered across different specialisations. IIT Delhi admission to various MSc specialisations differs. For IITD MSc admission in Chemistry is based on a valid IIT JAM score, followed by a CCMN Counselling round. For more detailed information related to the IIT Delhi MSc course, candidates are advised to contact the admission department of the institute.

mainEntity.name: What are the courses for MBA at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: During the two-year MBA programme of IIT Delhi, candidates are given an opportunity to choose courses in major streams. The courses available for major stream are Information Systems, Marketing, Finance, Stratergic Management, and Operations Management. Additionally, apart from the functional areas of specialisations, candidates are also provided with a cross functional perspective.

mainEntity.name: How many specialisations are offered under IIT Delhi PG Diploma course?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi offers PG Diploma course in D.I.I.T (Naval Construction) and Metro Rail Transport: Technology and Management.

mainEntity.name: What are the courses available at IIT Delhi with JEE Advanced cutoff rank up to 2500?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi BTech Cutoff 2024 was concluded based on JEE Advanced scores across multiple courses. The closing cutoff ranks for different BTech/Integrated BTech courses ranged between 116 and 6102, for the General AI candidates. For cutoff rank upto 2500, the courses available are Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical Engineering, B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering (Power and Automation), Integrated B.Tech. + M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering, Integrated B.Tech. + M.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing, B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing Engineering and B.Tech. in Engineering and Computational Mechanics. The given courses are as per the last round cutoff, for the General AI category. The ranks may vary according to category and gender.

mainEntity.name: I am getting IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay for Chemical and IIT Gandhinagar for CSE. What should I opt for?

acceptedAnswer.text: JEE Advanced cutoff 2024 has been released for the last round. For IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay, the last round cutoff for Chemical Engineering were 2221 and 2545, respectively, for the General AI category candidates. For IIT Gandhinagar, the last round cutoff for CSE was 1708. So, to answer your question, IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay are always a good options as compared to IIT Gandhinagar based on their NIRF ranking. For Chemical Engineering, both IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay are highly recommended as they have excellent faculty, research opportunities, and strong alumni networks. Also, Chemical Engineering offers you an opportunity to work in PSU, whereas CSE students don’t have that opportunity. However, On the other hand, a CSE student have an opportunity to work in MNC’s with higher salary package even more than what PSU’s give. But since, IIT Gandhinagar has been ranked 18th in the NIRF Ranking 2024, you must consider its other aspects such as placement, ROI etc to take your decision.

mainEntity.name: Does IIT Delhi offer Executive MBA?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, IIT Delhi offers an Executive MBA programme through DMS. Eligibility requires a minimum of 60% aggregate in graduation or 55% for reserved categories. Applicants need a minimum of 2 years post-qualifying work experience. Specialization in Technology Management mandates a background in Engineering/Technology/Physical Sciences/Statistics/Economics/Commerce/CA/ICWAI. Selection is based on a Personal Interview.

mainEntity.name: What are the core subjects covered in B.Tech Mathematics and Computing course at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: The course curriculum of IIT Delhi BTech in Mathematics and Computing programme include institute core and departmental core subjects. Each of the subject has some credit attached to it. Moreover, the curriculum has department electives as well, such as computer networks, embedded systems, and more. Mentioned below are some of the core subjects: Engineering Mechanics Environmental Science Introduction to Computer Science Introduction to Electrical Engineering Introduction to Electrical Engineering (Lab) Introduction to Engineering Visualisation Product Realisation through Manufacturing

mainEntity.name: Has IIT Delhi introduced new specialisations under BTech?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, IIT Delhi has introduced two new specialisations under BTech up recently. These included: B.Tech. in Engineering and Computational Mechanics (ECM) B.Tech. in Data Science and Engineering (DSE) The IIT Delhi BTech ECM programme is designed to prepare students for careers in engineering and computational mechanics. The programme will cover a broad range of topics, including Engineering Mechanics, Computational Mechanics, and finite element analysis. Students will also have the opportunity to specialize in a particular area of Engineering Mechanics, such as Structural Mechanics, Fluid Mechanics, or Heat Transfer. The IIT Delhi BTech Data Science programme is designed to prepare students for careers in Data Science and Engineering. The programme will cover a broad range of topics, including Data Science Fundamentals, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Students will also have the opportunity to specialize in a particular area of Data Science, such as Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, or Data Mining.

mainEntity.name: Which is the best course offered at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: BTech is the flagship course of IIT Delhi. The best branches of IIT Delhi BTech programme are Computer Science, Mathematics and Computing, and Electrical Engineering. The 5-year integrated B.Tech plus M.Tech in CSE is also highly popular among students. For securing a seat in IIT Delhi CSE specialisations, a candidate must obtain a rank under 100, whereas for securing a seat in Mathematics and Computing specialisation, a rank under 320 or so is needed. For students who want to prepare for CAT along with doing BTech, IIT Delhi will be convenient as there are plenty of good CAT coaching centres near the IIT Delhi campus.

mainEntity.name: Why is BTech CSE the most popular course at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi BTech CSE is the most popular course because it is a highly in-demand field with a lot of job opportunities, high salaries, and a challenging and rewarding work environment. IIT Delhi is a top-ranked university with a strong CSE department and a good placement record for CSE students. In addition to these general reasons, there are also some specific reasons why IIT Delhi CSE is so popular at IIT Delhi: IIT Delhi is a top-ranked university: IIT Delhi is consistently ranked as one of the top engineering and technical universities in India and the world. It's the 2nd best Engineering institute of India (as per NIRF 2023) and 197th ]in the world (as per QS Ranking 2024) which means that a BTech CSE degree from IIT Delhi is highly respected by employers. IIT Delhi has a strong CSE department: IIT Delhi's CSE department is one of the best in India. The department has a strong faculty and a well-designed curriculum. IIT Delhi has a good placement record: IIT Delhi has a good placement record for CSE students. In recent years, over 90% of CSE students at IIT Delhi have been placed in jobs.

mainEntity.name: Is IIT Delhi good for an MBA?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Department of Management Studies (DMS), IIT Delhi, also known as DMS IIT Delhi offers a two-year MBA course at undergraduate courses in a full-time mode. IIT Delhi is a decent option to pursue an MBA degree. IIT Delhi ranked 4 by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) in the Management category IN 2024. Talking about DMS IIT Delhi MBA placements 2023, the average package offered was INR 25.82 LPA and the highest package stood at INR 41.13 LPA. A placement percentage of 100% was achieved. Thus, it is a good institute for an MBA.

mainEntity.name: What is the JEE Advanced cut off for B.Tech in Civil Engineering in IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: For 2022, cut off was 4316 for General category candidates in All India quota for B.Tech. in Civil Engineering in IIT Delhi - Indian Institute of Technology Delhi. For female candidates in the General category under All India quota, 8,274 was the closing rank. IIT Delhi B.Tech Civil Engineering cut off 2023 will vary depending on the category and domicile/quota of the applicant.

mainEntity.name: What is IIT Delhi BDes cutoff 2024?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi cutoff 2024 for the BDes course is based on the applicant's UCCED scores followed by the UCEED Counselling. The last-round closing rank for the General AI category was 35. UCEED Counselling is generally conducted in five rounds. Candidates looking for IIT Delhi admissions must meet the UCEED cutoff for further process of counselling. IIT Delhi UCEED Last Round cutoff 2024 has been released in the form of opening and closing ranks for various categories. The First and Last Round ranks for General AI Category candidates are mentioned below: Course Round 1 - Closing Ranks Last Round - Closing Ranks Bachelor of Design (BDes) 32 35

mainEntity.name: What is the JEE Advanced cut off for BTech in Production and Industrial Engineering at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: According to latest data, cut off was 3089 for General category candidates in All India quota for BTech in Production and Industrial Engineering in IIT Delhi - Indian Institute of Technology. The opening rank in general category under All India quota, 2452 was the closing rank. Moreover, the BTech cutoff varies depending on the category and domicile/quota of the applicant.

mainEntity.name: What is the previous year CAT cutoff for OBC for DMS IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi MBA cutoff is based on CAT cutoff. This cutoff is released catgeory-wise. mainEntity.name: What is the cutoff for BTech in Mathematics and Computing Engineering at IIT Delhi for other than general categories?

acceptedAnswer.text: The last year 2022 cutoff ranks for BTech in Mathematics and Computing Engineering at IIT Delhi other than General category are - 243 for OBC, 155 for SC, 96 for ST, 85 for EWS, and 23 for PWD. While the admissions are based on the scores/rank obtained in JEE exam, the last cut offs also change a lot depending on All India quota or Home State. It also varies if the applicant is a female.

mainEntity.name: What is the highest package offered during IIT Delhi placements?

acceptedAnswer.text: According to media reports, 50 students received domestic offers with package more than INR 1 crore per annum during IIT Delhi placements 2023. Further, the highest international package offered during IIT Delhi placements 2023 stood at INR 2.5 crore per annum. The highest domestic and international package offered during IIT Delhi placements 2023 and 2022 are presented below: Particulars Placement Statistics (2022) Placement Statistics (2023) Highest domestic package INR 1.25 crore per annum INR 1 crore per annum Highest international package INR 2 crore per annum INR 2.5 crore per annum

mainEntity.name: How good are the BTech placements at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: A total of 1,200 offers were made and 1,150 students were placed during the Phase 1 of IIT Delhi placements 2025. Further, more than 50 international offers were made during IIT Delhi Phase 1 placements 2024-25. According to Engineering NIRF report 2024, the median package offered during BTech placements 2023, 2022 and 2021 stood at INR 20 LPA, INR 20.5 LPA and INR 17.6 LPA, respectively. According to unofficial sources, the placement rate recorded during IIT Delhi BTech placements 2023 was 90.01%.

mainEntity.name: What is the IIT Delhi average package offered during the recent placement drive?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi average package is not released. However, as per some unofficial sources, the average package offered during IIT Delhi placements 2023 stood at INR 21.9 LPA. Further, as per IIT Delhi Engineering NIRF 2024, the course-wise median package offered over the past three years are presented below: Course Median Package (2021) Median Package (2022) Median Package (2023) UG 4-year (BTech) INR 17.6 LPA INR 20.5 LPA INR 20 LPA UG 5-year (Dual Degree) INR 22 LPA INR 20 LPA INR 22 LPA PG 2-year (MTech) INR 15 LPA INR 12.5 LPA INR 14 LPA

mainEntity.name: How are the placements at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: At end of IIT Delhi Phase 1 placements 2024-25, a total of 1,200 offers were made and 1,150 students were placed. In addition, more than 50 international offers were made during IIT Delhi Phase 1 placements 2024-25. Earlier, Core (Technical) sector emerged as the top recruiting sector that placed 36.6% of the total students during IIT Delhi placement 2024 followed by IT and Analytics sectors that placed 20.7% and 10.9% of the total students, respectively. The placement rate recorded during IIT Delhi placements 2023 and 2022 stood at 84.94% and 82%, respectively. The key highlights of IIT Delhi placements over the past three years are presenetd below: Particulars Placement Statistics (2023) Placement Statistics (2024) Placement Statistics (2025) Total offers 1300 1050 1200 Students placed 1150 1000 1150 International offers 30 50 50+ Companies visited 500 370 NA Average package INR 21.9 LPA NA NA Median package INR 19.5 LPA NA NA Placement rate 84.94% NA NA

mainEntity.name: What is the career scope after MSc from IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: After completing MSc from IIT Delhi, candidates are open to placement opportunities. As per IITD NIRF report 2023, the median package offered to PG (2-year) candidates was INR 12.50 LPA. Further, MSc degree holders can work in different job profiles such as research scientist, teacher, biochemist, chemical analyst, junior research fellow, etc. Some of the top recruiters for MSc course graduates are mentioned in the following table: Top Recruiters for MSc Graduates Bhabha Atomic Research Centre Infosys Wipro Ranbaxy GAIL ONGC HCL ISRO BAARC BHEL GlaxoSmithKline Cipla Read more about MSc course highlights, eligibility, entrance exams, and more, here.

mainEntity.name: How to apply for IIT Delhi after GATE?

acceptedAnswer.text: Candidates who meet the course-specific eligibility criteria and have a valid GATE score can apply. Aspirants can complete the application form through the IIT Delhi official website. This is for M.Tech full-time programmes. For part-time/sponsored full-time courses, eligible candidates can register directly at the official website. Admission to part-time M.Tech is based on a written exam and interview round conducted by the institute.

mainEntity.name: Can I get direct admission to MSc at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, IIT Delhi does not offer direct admission to the MSc programme. Students planning to seek admission to IIT Delhi MSc programmes must apply for a Joint Admission Test, known as IIT JAM. IIT JAM is a national-level entrance examination conducted to provide admissions in MSc and other related postgraduate courses provided across IITs. Interested candidates can apply for JAM 2025 using the JAM Online Application Processing System, or JOAPS, only. Interested candidates must submit the application forms before the deadline at the JOAPS website, which is accessible on the IIT Delhi website.

mainEntity.name: How can I get into M.Tech at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: For IIT Delhi M.Tech admission, candidates must have a valid GATE score. Aspirants are also supposed to meet the minimum eligibility criteria set by the institute. Candidates seeking admission to IIT Delhi M.Tech course must visit the official website of GATE to apply online. Registered candidates are then required to appear for the GATE entrance exam. Candidates shortlisted based on exam score are further required to participate in COAP counselling.

mainEntity.name: Does IIT Delhi offer direct admission for any course?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, admission to the IIT Delhi courses is entrance-based, except for PG Diploma course. There is no provision for direct admission. However, for IIT Delhi MTech admission, the institute offers direct admission to candidates with an overall CGPA of 8.00 out of 10. Those students are exempted from GATE and are eligible for direct admissions. The below table mentions course-wise accepted entrance exams: Courses Accepted Entrance Exam BTech JEE Main/JEE Advanced MBA CAT MTech GATE MSc IIT JAM BDes UCEED MDes UCEED

mainEntity.name: How can I prepare for admission to BTech at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: The preparation for JEE Main begins two years in advance. It is a national-level exam, which can be passed with a good base of concepts and preparation. A good preparation strategy is what will help a student ace the JEE Main 2023 exam. Some of the pointers to include in the action plan are mentioned below: Revise topics section-wise Cross-check section-wise weightage & syllabus for all subjects covered in JEE Main Solve as many Mock Tests as possible. Shiksha.com is providing FREE Downloadable JEE Main Mock Test Paper (with Solutions). Solve previous year’s JEE question papers there are high chances of getting questions from there Refer to a few reference books to have a better understanding of topics To secure admission into prestigious institutions such as the IITs, NITs and IIITs, it is essential for the aspirants to have a strong command on the material taught in their class 11 and class 12. Shiksha is offering free NCERT questions and solutions to aid JEE candidates in excelling in these classes. To access the NCERT solutions, click on the below links: NCERT Class 11 Physics Solutions NCERT Class 11 Chemistry Solutions Downloadable3 Class 11 Maths Solutions The first step is to clear JEE Main, however, the ultimate objective must be to qualify JEE Advanced exam, check out the Downloadable2 strategy for JEE Advanced.

mainEntity.name: Does passing UCEED 2023 guarantee BDes admission to IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: Candidates seeking admission to IIT Delhi BDes course are required to appear for UCEED 2023 exam, which is conducted by IIT Bombay. UCEED releases qualifying cutoff in the form of mean deviation and standard deviation. Appearing in UCEED 2023 or being on the admission rank list does not guarantee admission to IIT Delhi BDes courses. Candidates who have passed UCEED 2023 must apply separately to the UCEED participating institute for BDes admission. Apart from passing the UCEED exam, the candidates are required to fulfil the eligibility criteria, category certificates and other documents, as well as the UCEED score, to be verified by IIT Delhi.

mainEntity.name: Can I do MTech at IIT Delhi without GATE?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi MTech admission is completely entrance-based. Candidates seeking admission to the IIT Delhi MTech course must appear for the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE). However, BTech graduates from IITs with an overall CGPA of 8.00 out of 10 are exempted from GATE and are eligible for direct admissions. Apart from this, candidates are also requested to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria to be eligible for IIT Delhi MTech admission.

mainEntity.name: How many seats are available for IIT Delhi M.Tech course?

acceptedAnswer.text: The number of seats available for M.Tech specialisations at IIT Delhi is 1568. In the following table, specialisation-wise seat breakup is provided: Courses Seats M.Tech. in Geotechnical and Geoenvironmental Engineering 44 M.Tech. in Rock Engineering and Underground Structures 44 M.Tech. in Structural Engineering 44 M.Tech. in Chemical Engineering 44 M.Tech. in Molecular Engineering (Chemical Synthesis and Analysis) 44

mainEntity.name: What is the minimum eligibility criteria of IIT Delhi MDes programme?

acceptedAnswer.text: For IIT Delhi M.Des admission, candidates must have passed BE/ BTech/ BDes/ BArch or equivalent degree in a relevant field with a CGPA of 6.00 on a 10-point scale or 60% aggregate. Apart from the minimum eligibility requirement, candidates are also required to appear for the CEED entrance test.

mainEntity.name: Can I do MBA from IIT Delhi without CAT?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, the institute offers admission based on CAT scores. Candidates seeking admission to IIT Delhi MBA course must apply online for CAT. IIT Delhi MBA admission is based on candidates' performance in the CAT entrance test, followed by a GD & PI round. Apart from this, candidates are also required to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria for IIT Delhi MBA admission. To be eligible for MBA admission at IIT Delhi, candidates must have a Bachelor's degree or equivalent of a minimum of three-years duration after Class 12 with a CGPA of 6.00 on a 10-point scale or 60% aggregate.

mainEntity.name: What is the ranking of IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi ranks amongst the top five IITs in India. IITD has ranked 2 under 'Engineering' and 4 under 'Overall' and 'Management' categories by the NIRF 2023. In the QS World University Rankings 2025, the institute has secured #150 position. Being one of the elite Engineering institutes of India, IIT Delhi has been ranked by multiple organisations under various categories such as MBA, Engineering, Research, etc. It has also ranked 4 by the NIRF 2023 under its new category 'Research Institutions'. Internationally, IIT Delhi ranked 197 by the QS World Ranking 2024 and 46 by the QS Asia Rankings 2023. It has ranked in the top 3 Engineering colleges for the last consecutive 5 years.

mainEntity.name: What is the JAM 2023 third admission list opening and closing rank for MSc specialisations at IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi cut off 2023 for JAM 2023 Third Admission List, the opening and closing ranks for MSc Economics are 1 and 10, respectively. Tabulated below are IIT JAM 2023 Opening Ranks (ORs) and Closing Ranks (CRs) for various MSc specialisations offered at IIT Delhi: MSc/ MSc - PhD Specialisation ORs CRs Chemistry 22 114 Mathematics 27 145 Physics 3 156 Economics 1 10

mainEntity.name: What rank is required in IIT JAM for IIT Delhi MSc admission?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIT Delhi MSc cutoff 2024 has been released for Round 1, wherein, JAM in Economics is the most competitive specialsiation with a closing rank of 9 for the General AII India category students. The least competitive course is M.Sc.in Biological Sciences with a cutoff rank of 488. So, candidates seeking admission to any of the MSc course must secure a rank upto 488 to be eligible for IIT Delhi IIT Delhi admissio to the MSc course is based on IIT JAM scores, followed by IIT JAM counselling process. Only candidates in the JAM 2024 Merit List based on JAM 2024 scorecard will be eligible to apply for admission.

mainEntity.name: What is the minimum rank required to get a call from IIT Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: To get into IIT Delhi for MSc admission, IIT JAM scores (ranks) are considered. The IIT Delhi JAM Cutoff 2024 was concluded for MSc courses for different categories under the AI category. For the General AI category candidates, the closing ranks for MSc courses ranged between 32 and 541.
